title.rendered: Flower, Vapes, Tinctures, or Edibles? Delivery Methods Under Florida Law

content.rendered:
Ever wondered which cannabis option fits into your life—and your treatment plan?

From a quick puff to long-lasting gummies, Florida law lets you tailor relief.

Key Delivery Methods for Florida’s Medical Marijuana Program

1. Inhalation: Flower & Vaporizing

Why choose it? Instant relief—ideal for breakthrough pain or anxiety.

Smoking Flower

  • Onset & Duration: 1–5 min to feel effects; lasts 1–3 hrs.
  • Legal Limits: Purchase up to 2.5 oz per 35 days; possess up to 4 oz.. (§ 381.986, F.S.)
  • Quick Tip: Inhale slowly—pause between puffs to fine-tune your dose.

Vaporizing

  • Onset & Duration: Same timeline, but with reduced combustion by-products.
  • MMUR Category: Vape cartridges, pens, sealed flower pods, concentrates.
  • Quick Tip: Aim for 350–375°F to balance flavor and potency.

2. Sublingual: Tinctures

Why choose it? Middle ground—faster than edibles, smoother than inhalation.

  • Onset & Duration: 10–20 min; relief for 2–6 hrs.
  • MMUR Category: Sublingual or Oral (dropper bottles).
  • Quick Tip: Hold under your tongue 45 seconds before swallowing for best absorption.
  • Dosing: Start at 0.25 mL, increase by 0.25 mL as needed.

3. Oral Consumption: Capsules, Oils & Edibles

Why choose it? Slow onset, long-lasting—perfect for overnight comfort.

  • Onset & Duration: 30 min–2 hrs; effects 6–8 hrs.

  • Limits:
    • ≤10 mg THC per serving
    • ≤200 mg THC per package
    • ≤60 mg THC/day for edibles (Emergency Order Aug 2022)
    • 70-day supply cap (24,500 mg THC total)
  • Quick Tip: Always wait a full 2 hrs before redosing—patience avoids overconsumption.

4. Topical & Transdermal Applications

Why choose it? Localized relief or steady systemic dosing—no “high.”

  • Topicals (creams/gels): Onset ~20 min; relief up to 4 hrs.
  • Transdermals (patches): Onset 30–60 min; steady effect 24–72 hrs.
  • Quick Tip: Rotate patch sites daily to prevent skin irritation.

5. Suppositories

Why choose it? High bioavailability; useful when swallowing isn’t an option.

  • Onset & Duration: 15–30 min; relief 6–12 hrs.
  • MMUR Category: Special-order Suppository.
  • Quick Tip: Store refrigerated if your home is warm; proper insertion ensures comfort.

Legal Purchase Limits & Registry Categories

Flower (Smoking)
Purchase Limits - ≤ 2.5 oz per 35 days

Possession & Notes -≤ 4 oz at any time


Inhalation (Vapes/Concentrates)
Purchase Limits - ≤ 24,500 mg THC per 70-day supply cap

Possession & Notes - Shares the non-smokable supply limit


Oral & Edibles
Purchase Limits - ≤ 60 mg THC/day; ≤ 200 mg/package; 70-day cap

Sublingual & Tinctures
Purchase Limits - 70-day supply cap (24,500 mg THC)


Topicals & Transdermals
Purchase Limits - 70-day supply cap

Suppositories
Purchase Limits - 70-day supply cap

Possession & Notes No per-mg restriction


Delivery Method Purchase Limits Possession & Notes
Flower (Smoking) ≤ 2.5 oz per 35 days ≤ 4 oz at any time
Inhalation (Vapes/Concentrates) ≤ 24,500 mg THC per 70-day supply cap Shares the non-smokable supply limit
Oral & Edibles ≤ 60 mg THC/day; ≤ 200 mg/package; 70-day cap —
Sublingual & Tinctures 70-day supply cap (24,500 mg THC) —
Topicals & Transdermals 70-day supply cap No per-mg restriction
Suppositories 70-day supply cap —

Packaging, Labeling & Advertising Rules

  • Packaging: Child-resistant, opaque containers—no candy-style designs.
  • Labels Require: THC/CBD per serving+package, MMTC logo, universal cannabis symbol (≥ 10% surface), QR code to lab reports, clear usage & warnings.
  • Advertising: Prohibited in public spaces; no minor-appealing content; online ads need state approval and easy opt-out.

Practical Tips for Patients

  • Match Method to Need: Fast vs. sustained relief; local vs. systemic.
  • Dose Safely: “Start low, go slow,” especially with edibles & suppositories.
  • Check Quality: Always scan the QR code to review third-party test results.
  • Consult Your Physician: Never adjust your plan without medical guidance.

Risks & Safety

  • Common Side Effects: Dry mouth, dizziness, mild sedation, skin irritation.
  • Safety Strategy: Avoid driving until you know how each method affects you.

Conclusion: Find Your Fit

Every patient is unique. Use this guide to explore options under Florida law—and partner with Dr. Rosado to customize a safe, effective treatment plan.

Ready to dial in your relief? Book a personalized consultation with Dr. Rosado today.

FAQs

  1. Can I mix methods? Yes—combine fast-acting inhalation with longer-acting edibles or tinctures.
  2. Are topicals psychoactive? No—they act locally and don’t cross into the brain.
  3. What happens if I exceed my limits? Exceeding MMUR caps (§ 381.986, F.S.) may lead to penalties.
  4. Do I need separate MMUR orders? Only flower needs their order; other methods can share one.
  5. Where can I find updates? Visit the Florida DOH Office of Medical Marijuana Use: https://knowthefactsmmj.com

Ready to Personalize Your Relief Plan?

Dr. Rosado helps you use it wisely.

Book a confidential consultation now.
